info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 07 at 4:58AM EST until March 07 at 8:00AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM EST FOR NORTHERN KENTON...NORTHERN CAMPBELL...CENTRAL BOONE AND SOUTHERN HAMILTON COUNTIES... At 458 AM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Florence, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Covington, Florence, Independence, Norwood, Erlanger, Fort Thomas, Newport, Madeira, Edgewood, Alexandria, Elsmere, Fort Mitchell, Villa Hills, Highland Heights, Milford, Taylor Mill, Bellevue, Fort Wright and Dayton. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 7. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 176 and 191. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 3. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
